alert.note: Alert for Adams; Wells (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 24 at 6:29AM EST until February 25 at 3:00PM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana... Wabash River near Linn Grove affecting Wells and Adams Counties. .Heavy rain on Wednesday has caused the Wabash River at Linn Grove to exceed minor flood stage. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River near Linn Grove. * WHEN...From this morning through this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Agricultural flooding begins. Low lands east of Geneva begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 AM EST Friday the stage was 11.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:45 AM EST Friday was 11.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 5.2 feet early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
